keyMoments.title: Water Luffy Technique Debut
keyMoments.description: Luffy drinks an entire barrel of water and dubs himself 'Water Luffy' to counter Crocodile's sand abilities by squirting water from his mouth.
keyMoments.significance: First instance of Luffy developing a creative counter-strategy against a Logia-type devil fruit user.

keyMoments.title: Mizu Mizu no Pistol Debut
keyMoments.description: Luffy uses a water-enhanced version of his signature Gomu Gomu no Pistol attack.
keyMoments.significance: Shows evolution of Luffy's basic techniques when adapted to specific opponents.

keyMoments.title: Luffy Loses Second Round Against Crocodile
keyMoments.description: Despite using water strategy and landing hits, Luffy loses the second round against Crocodile.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates that even with clever strategy, Luffy lacks the experience to defeat a Warlord.

abilities.description: Luffy drinks a large amount of water and uses it to dampen Crocodile's sand body, making him vulnerable to physical attacks.
A water-enhanced version of Gomu Gomu no Pistol used while in Water Luffy form.

keyMoments.title: Ground Secco Technique Debut
keyMoments.description: Crocodile uses his dehydration ability to dry out a massive area, turning the palace garden into wasteland.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals the devastating scale of Crocodile's sand-based powers.

keyMoments.title: Ground Death Technique Debut
keyMoments.description: Crocodile uses an enhanced version of Ground Secco that transforms everything it touches into sand.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Crocodile as one of the most dangerous enemies Luffy has faced.

keyMoments.title: Crocodile's Dehydration Hand Demonstrated
keyMoments.description: Crocodile demonstrates his right hand's ability to instantly desiccate anything it touches on a large scale.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals one of Crocodile's most dangerous abilities.

bounties.reason: Original bounty before becoming a Warlord

abilities.description: Crocodile places his hand on the ground to dry out a huge area, turning it into desert wasteland and causing it to crumble.
An extremely strong version of Ground Secco that transforms anything with ground contact into sand.

keyMoments.title: Robin Forces Cobra to Reveal Pluton Poneglyph Location
keyMoments.description: Nico Robin forces King Cobra to lead her to the Tomb of the Kings where the Poneglyph containing information about Pluton is hidden.
keyMoments.significance: Major revelation about Robin's knowledge of ancient weapons and introduces the concept of Pluton.

keyMoments.title: Robin's Childhood Bounty Revealed
keyMoments.description: It is revealed that Nico Robin received a bounty of 79 million berries at age eight for supposedly sinking six Marine ships, though the real reason was her ability to read Poneglyphs.
keyMoments.significance: Provides crucial context for Robin's character and her life on the run.

keyMoments.title: Robin's Hatred of World Government Revealed
keyMoments.description: Robin explicitly states she despises anyone affiliated with the World Government.
keyMoments.significance: Character development that foreshadows her eventual backstory reveal.

keyMoments.title: Robin Uses Treinta Fleur
keyMoments.description: Robin uses 'Treinta Fleur' (Thirty Flowers), sprouting thirty arms to restrain targets.
keyMoments.significance: Showcases the versatility of Robin's Devil Fruit abilities.

keyMoments.title: Robin Uses Strangle Technique
keyMoments.description: Robin uses her 'Strangle' technique, sprouting hands to choke or restrain opponents.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the combat applications of Robin's Devil Fruit abilities.

bounties.reason: Ability to read Poneglyphs after Ohara incident (officially blamed for sinking six Marine ships)

abilities.description: Robin sprouts thirty arms using her Hana Hana no Mi ability.
Robin uses sprouted hands to choke or restrain opponents by wrapping around their necks or bodies.

reveals.information: Had a 79 million berry bounty at age 8
Despises the World Government due to past persecution

name.japanese: ネフェルタリ・コブラ

keyMoments.title: Cobra Forced to Reveal Poneglyph Location
keyMoments.description: King Cobra is forced by Nico Robin to lead her to the Tomb of the Kings where the Poneglyph about Pluton is hidden.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the burden of protecting ancient secrets that the Nefertari family has carried for generations.

keyMoments.title: Vivi Searches for the Bomb
keyMoments.description: Vivi works with the Straw Hats to frantically search for the massive time bomb threatening Alubarna.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Vivi's dedication to saving her people and kingdom.
